title: Soil Health and Organic Grains with Miranda Sikora

tasks.task: Participate in an organic row crop management workshop focusing on soil health.
subtasks: Listen to Dr. Matt Rourke explain the concept of soil health and its indicators.
Consider management practices that influence soil health during the Q&A.
Analyze results from the field survey of 16 organic grain and dairy farms, noting challenges in linking specific practices to measurable soil health differences.
Examine long-term trial results from the Wisconsin Integrated Cropping Systems Trial highlighting the benefits of perennial cover and reduced tillage.
Understand the role of soil biology in soil health and the limitations of current microbial testing methods discussed by Dr. Teal Potter.
Reflect on the necessity of maintaining and enhancing soil health through management practices such as reducing tillage and cover cropping.
